intro: Diderota amphicarpa, commonly known as the two-seeded diderota, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its distinctive two-seeded capsule fruit, which is a key feature in its botanical classification. Its flowers are typically small and clustered, with five petals and stamens. Diderota amphicarpa is of interest to botanists due to its limited distribution and unique reproductive structures.
